intro: Scandix latifolia, commonly known as broadleaf scurvygrass, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or greenish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Scandix latifolia is known for its medicinal properties, particularly its use in traditional remedies for respiratory and digestive ailments.
